frame.name: FR_Purpose
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> has or thinks about a <fen>Goal</fen>. The <fen>Goal</fen> is a state of the world that does not currently hold but which the <fen>Agent</fen> is planning and/or working towards or just thinking as an opportunity. It is also possible for a <fen>Medium</fen> or a <fen>Means</fen> to be expressed instead of (or in addition to) this <fen>Agent</fen>. <fen>Medium</fen> is an informational content that has been created to allow the creator or an user to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>, and the <fen>Means</fen> is an act performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> to achieve its <fen>Goal</fen>.
In some cases a <fen>Time_of_Eventuality</fen> on the <fen>Goal</fen> state of affairs can be given prominence as a separate constituent.
<ex>The modest <fex name="Agent">American</fex> <t>goal</t> <fex name="Goal">of a threefold increase in capacity</fex> recognises this fact .</ex> <ex>The <t>goal</t> <fex name="Medium">of the tutorial</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Goal">to help a student concentrate on his writing skills</fex> </ex> <ex> The prime <t>goal</t> <fex name="Means">of the programme</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="Goal">to help develop processes of scientific thinking in children</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">My</fex> <t>goal</t> <fex name="Medium">in this book</fex> <m>is</m> <fex name="Goal">to introduce the reader to Web programming applications</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">The president's</fex> <fex name="Domain">economic</fex> <t>goal</t> <fex name="Restrictor">for the country </fex><m>was</m> <fex name="Goal">to overcome the recession</fex>.</ex>
<ex></ex>
Distinctions with other frames:
<ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>FR_Means_for_purpose</frframe> : for the LUs of the FR_Purpose frame, the Agent can be realized locally (generally in core set with the Means FE), while the Agent cannot be locally expressed for the LUs of FR_Means_for_purpose (prepositions, conjunctions...).
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>Willingness</frframe> : in the Willingness frame, the Cognizer is willing to engage in an activity if prompted to do so, but they haven't made a decision, whereas with FR_Purpose, the Agent has, to a certain extent, formed an intention to achieve the Goal.</ex>
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Deciding</frframe> : <frframe>FR_Deciding</frframe>'s Cognizer is not necessarily the one supposed to perform the decided action, whereas with FR_Purpose, the Goal necessarily involves the Cognizer. In cases in which the Cognizer is the one who will perform the decided action: the FR_Deciding frame is inchoative of most triggers in the FR_Intention frame: once a FR_Deciding event has taken place, its Decision role becomes the Goal of FR_Intention.</ex>
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>Desiring</frframe> : we make a purely semantic distinction between the LUs encoding the idea of desire (performing the desired action would please the Cognizer, but the LU does not encode the idea of the Cognizer making actual plans to perform the action) versus those focusing on the idea of goal only. Cf. the contrast between "FR: Paul veut aller au ski" versus "FR: Paul a le projet d'aller au ski"
<ex></ex>
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : derived from Purpose, from which have been removed core FEs Attribute and Value and to which has been added core FE Medium. The Restrictor FE which initially covered both spatial or temporal restriction on the Goal has been replaced by the Time_of_Eventuality FE. The non-Core Domain and Time FEs have been removed. The semantics of the frame has been extended to cover cases in which the Agent is not totally determined to achieve the Goal (FR: envisager de, songer à Vinf) <ex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The volitional actor who intends to achieve a goal. <ex> <fex name="Agent">Microsoft 's</fex> <t>goal</t> of delivering a million copies in the first year is trifling compared to the 25 million copies of Windows it has shipped since May 1990.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action or state of affairs that the Agent wants to achieve.
<ex>The company missed its <t>goal</t> <fex name="Goal">of getting a thousand third-party software packages shipped</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Means</fen> is an act performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> which enables them to to achieve a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex> The <t>goal</t> <fex name="Means">of treatment</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="Goal">to lower diastolic blood pressure below 85 mm Hg</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is an informational content that has been created to achieve a particular <fen>Goal</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate an <fen>Attribute</fen> for which it is the <fen>Agent</fen>'s goal that it have or reach a particular <fen>Value</fen> .
<ex>We exceeded our <fex name="Attribute">production</fex> <t>target</t> of 2000 units</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate which <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Agent</fen> wants the <fen>Attribute</fen> to reach.
<ex>GM has a production <t>target</t> <fex name="Value">of 2,000,000 units</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_Eventuality
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate a temporal framework relative to which the <fen>Goal</fen> is said to hold.
<ex>Our sales <t>target</t> <fex name="Time_of_Eventuality">for that week</fex> was 200 units</ex></def-root>
